intro: Hedyotis rennellensis, commonly known as the Rennell island geranium, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rennell in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
